bug.author: adityanathan
bug.summary: "fatal error:'cmath' file not found" - Error while trying to build mlpack on Mac OSx.
bug.description:
Hi. I was trying to build mlpack on Mac OSx Mojave Beta and after installing the dependencies(armadillo, cmake and boost) when executing the make command I got the following error. Can somebody please help me out ? Thank you. <denchmark-h:hr></denchmark-h>
[ 16%] Linking CXX executable ../../../../bin/generate_pyx_nca [ 16%] Built target generate_pyx_nca Scanning dependencies of target build_pyx_nca [ 16%] Building Cython binding nca.so... /anaconda3/lib/python3.6/distutils/dist.py:261: UserWarning: Unknown distribution option: 'long_description_content_type' warnings.warn(msg) running build_ext cythoning /Users/aditya/GSOC/mlpack-3.0.4/build/src/mlpack/bindings/python/mlpack/nca.pyx to /Users/aditya/GSOC/mlpack-3.0.4/build/src/mlpack/bindings/python/mlpack/nca.cpp building 'mlpack.nca' extension creating build/temp.macosx-10.7-x86_64-3.6 creating build/temp.macosx-10.7-x86_64-3.6/Users creating build/temp.macosx-10.7-x86_64-3.6/Users/aditya creating build/temp.macosx-10.7-x86_64-3.6/Users/aditya/GSOC creating build/temp.macosx-10.7-x86_64-3.6/Users/aditya/GSOC/mlpack-3.0.4 creating build/temp.macosx-10.7-x86_64-3.6/Users/aditya/GSOC/mlpack-3.0.4/build creating build/temp.macosx-10.7-x86_64-3.6/Users/aditya/GSOC/mlpack-3.0.4/build/src creating build/temp.macosx-10.7-x86_64-3.6/Users/aditya/GSOC/mlpack-3.0.4/build/src/mlpack creating build/temp.macosx-10.7-x86_64-3.6/Users/aditya/GSOC/mlpack-3.0.4/build/src/mlpack/bindings creating build/temp.macosx-10.7-x86_64-3.6/Users/aditya/GSOC/mlpack-3.0.4/build/src/mlpack/bindings/python creating build/temp.macosx-10.7-x86_64-3.6/Users/aditya/GSOC/mlpack-3.0.4/build/src/mlpack/bindings/python/mlpack gcc -Wno-unused-result -Wsign-compare -Wunreachable-code -DNDEBUG -g -fwrapv -O3 -Wall -Wstrict-prototypes -I/anaconda3/include -arch x86_64 -I/anaconda3/include -arch x86_64 -I/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/numpy/core/include -I/Users/aditya/GSOC/mlpack-3.0.4/build/src/mlpack/bindings/python/ -I/Users/aditya/GSOC/mlpack-3.0.4/src -I/usr/local/include -I/usr/local/include -I/Users/aditya/GSOC/mlpack-3.0.4/build/src/mlpack/.. -I/anaconda3/include/python3.6m -c /Users/aditya/GSOC/mlpack-3.0.4/build/src/mlpack/bindings/python/mlpack/nca.cpp -o build/temp.macosx-10.7-x86_64-3.6/Users/aditya/GSOC/mlpack-3.0.4/build/src/mlpack/bindings/python/mlpack/nca.o -DBINDING_TYPE=BINDING_TYPE_PYX -std=c++11 -O3 -Wno-unknown-pragmas warning: include path for stdlibc++ headers not found; pass '-std=libc++' on the command line to use the libc++ standard library instead [-Wstdlibcxx-not-found] In file included from /Users/aditya/GSOC/mlpack-3.0.4/build/src/mlpack/bindings/python/mlpack/nca.cpp:537: In file included from /Users/aditya/GSOC/mlpack-3.0.4/src/mlpack/core.hpp:256: /Users/aditya/GSOC/mlpack-3.0.4/src/mlpack/prereqs.hpp:16:10: fatal error: 'cmath' file not found #include ^~~~~~~ 1 warning and 1 error generated. error: command 'gcc' failed with exit status 1 make[2]: *** [src/mlpack/methods/nca/CMakeFiles/build_pyx_nca] Error 1 make[1]: *** [src/mlpack/methods/nca/CMakeFiles/build_pyx_nca.dir/all] Error 2 make: *** [all] Error 2

comments.comment: You probably have to upgrade xcode: xcode-select --install

I ran "xcode-select --install" on my terminal and then checked my Xcode version which turned out to be Xcode 10.1 (Build version 10B61) and I couldn't find any update options anywhere for Xcode so I executed "cmake ../" and "make" from my build directory again. Unfortunately, the same problem mentioned above still persists. It says cmath file not found. Please help me out. Thank you.
What happens if, with a new clean build directory, you configure with cmake -DCMAKE_CXX_FLAGS="-std=libc++" .. and then build?

I get the following error: $ cmake -DCMAKE_CXX_FLAGS="-std=libc++" .. -- The C compiler identification is AppleClang 10.0.0.10001145 -- The CXX compiler identification is AppleClang 10.0.0.10001145 -- Check for working C compiler: /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/cc -- Check for working C compiler: /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/cc -- works -- Detecting C compiler ABI info -- Detecting C compiler ABI info - done -- Detecting C compile features -- Detecting C compile features - done -- Check for working CXX compiler: /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/c++ -- Check for working CXX compiler: /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/c++ -- broken CMake Error at /opt/local/share/cmake-3.13/Modules/CMakeTestCXXCompiler.cmake:45 (message): The C++ compiler <denchmark-code>"/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/c++" </denchmark-code>
is not able to compile a simple test program. It fails with the following output: <denchmark-code>Change Dir: /Users/aditya/GSOC/mlpack-3.0.4/build/CMakeFiles/CMakeTmp
Run Build Command:"/usr/bin/make" "cmTC_ae3af/fast" /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/usr/bin/make -f CMakeFiles/cmTC_ae3af.dir/build.make CMakeFiles/cmTC_ae3af.dir/build Building CXX object CMakeFiles/cmTC_ae3af.dir/testCXXCompiler.cxx.o /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/c++ -std=libc++ -isysroot /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Platforms/MacOSX.platform/Developer/SDKs/MacOSX10.14.sdk -o CMakeFiles/cmTC_ae3af.dir/testCXXCompiler.cxx.o -c /Users/aditya/GSOC/mlpack-3.0.4/build/CMakeFiles/CMakeTmp/testCXXCompiler.cxx error: invalid value 'libc++' in '-std=libc++' note: use 'c++98' or 'c++03' for 'ISO C++ 1998 with amendments' standard note: use 'gnu++98' or 'gnu++03' for 'ISO C++ 1998 with amendments and GNU extensions' standard note: use 'c++11' for 'ISO C++ 2011 with amendments' standard note: use 'gnu++11' for 'ISO C++ 2011 with amendments and GNU extensions' standard note: use 'c++14' for 'ISO C++ 2014 with amendments' standard note: use 'gnu++14' for 'ISO C++ 2014 with amendments and GNU extensions' standard note: use 'c++17' for 'ISO C++ 2017 with amendments' standard note: use 'gnu++17' for 'ISO C++ 2017 with amendments and GNU extensions' standard note: use 'c++2a' for 'Working draft for ISO C++ 2020' standard note: use 'gnu++2a' for 'Working draft for ISO C++ 2020 with GNU extensions' standard make[1]: *** [CMakeFiles/cmTC_ae3af.dir/testCXXCompiler.cxx.o] Error 1 make: *** [cmTC_ae3af/fast] Error 2 </denchmark-code>
CMake will not be able to correctly generate this project. Call Stack (most recent call first): CMakeLists.txt:2 (project) -- Configuring incomplete, errors occurred! See also "/Users/aditya/GSOC/mlpack-3.0.4/build/CMakeFiles/CMakeOutput.log". See also "/Users/aditya/GSOC/mlpack-3.0.4/build/CMakeFiles/CMakeError.log".
Ah, sorry, can you try cmake -DCMAKE_CXX_FLAGS="-stdlib=libc++" ../ instead? (i.e. -stdlib= not -std=; I think the original error message has a typo)

I get the following error: [ 15%] Building Cython binding sparse_coding.so... /anaconda3/lib/python3.6/distutils/dist.py:261: UserWarning: Unknown distribution option: 'long_description_content_type' warnings.warn(msg) running build_ext cythoning /Users/aditya/GSOC/mlpack-3.0.4/build/src/mlpack/bindings/python/mlpack/sparse_coding.pyx to creating build/temp.macosx-10.7-x86_64-3.6/Users/aditya/GSOC/mlpack-3.0.4/build/src/mlpack/bindings/python/mlpack gcc -Wno-unused-result -Wsign-compare -Wunreachable-code -DNDEBUG -g -fwrapv -O3 -Wall -Wstrict-prototypes -I/anaconda3/include -arch x86_64 -I/anaconda3/include -arch x86_64 -I/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/numpy/core/include /anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/numpy/core/include/numpy/arrayobject.h:4: In file included from /anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/numpy/core/include/numpy/ndarrayobject.h:18: In file included from /anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/numpy/core/include/numpy/ndarraytypes.h:1816: /anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/numpy/core/include/numpy/npy_1_7_deprecated_api.h:15:2: warning: "Using deprecated NumPy API, disable it by " "#defining NPY_NO_DEPRECATED_API NPY_1_7_API_VERSION" [-W#warnings] #warning "Using deprecated NumPy API, disable it by " ^ 1 warning generated. creating build/lib.macosx-10.7-x86_64-3.6 creating build/lib.macosx-10.7-x86_64-3.6/mlpack g++ -bundle -undefined dynamic_lookup -L/anaconda3/lib -arch x86_64 -L/anaconda3/lib -arch x86_64 -arch x86_64 build/temp.macosx-10.7-x86_64-3.6/Users/aditya/GSOC/mlpack-3.0.4/build/src/mlpack/bindings/python/mlpack/sparse_coding.o -L/Users/aditya/GSOC/mlpack-3.0.4/build/lib/ -lmlpack -lboost_serialization -o build/lib.macosx-10.7-x86_64-3.6/mlpack/sparse_coding.cpython-36m-darwin.so clang: warning: libstdc++ is deprecated; move to libc++ with a minimum deployment target of OS X 10.9 [-Wdeprecated] ld: library not found for -lstdc++ clang: error: linker command failed with exit code 1 (use -v to see invocation) error: command 'g++' failed with exit status 1 make[2]: *** [src/mlpack/methods/sparse_coding/CMakeFiles/build_pyx_sparse_coding] Error 1 make[1]: *** [src/mlpack/methods/sparse_coding/CMakeFiles/build_pyx_sparse_coding.dir/all] Error 2 make: *** [all] Error 2

<denchmark-code>3.6/Users/aditya/GSOC/mlpack-3.0.4/build/src/mlpack/bindings/python/mlpack/nca.o -DBINDING_TYPE=BINDING_TYPE_PYX -std=c++11 -O3 -Wno-unknown-pragmas warning: include path for stdlibc++ headers not found; pass '-std=libc++' on the command line to use the libc++ standard library instead </denchmark-code>
According to the error message above: passing '-std=libc++' should work. I'm wondering if you need to update the command-line tools as well, or maybe it's easier to install XCode 9.

I already have Xcode and command line tools. Also when I passed -std=libc++ I got an error message after which <denchmark-link:https://github.com/rcurtin>@rcurtin</denchmark-link> told me it was a typo and instead I should pass -stdlib=libc++ $ /usr/bin/xcodebuild -version Xcode 10.1 Build version 10B61 $ xcode-select --install xcode-select: error: command line tools are already installed, use "Software Update" to install updates

Can you try downloading the file <denchmark-link:http://www.ratml.org/misc/setup.py.in>http://www.ratml.org/misc/setup.py.in</denchmark-link> and replacing the file with that? I made a couple changes to try and force it to link against libc++ instead of libstdc++. We can see if it works...

I replaced setup.py.in with the one in <denchmark-link:http://www.ratml.org/misc/setup.py.in>http://www.ratml.org/misc/setup.py.in</denchmark-link> provided by <denchmark-link:https://github.com/rcurtin>@rcurtin</denchmark-link> and I got the following message when I executed "cmake -DCMAKE_CXX_FLAGS="-std=libc++" .." : $ cmake -DCMAKE_CXX_FLAGS="-std=libc++" .. -- The CXX compiler identification is AppleClang 10.0.0.10001145 -- Check for working CXX compiler: /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/c++ -- Check for working CXX compiler: /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/c++ -- broken CMake Error at /opt/local/share/cmake-3.13/Modules/CMakeTestCXXCompiler.cmake:45 (message): The C++ compiler <denchmark-code>"/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/c++" </denchmark-code>
is not able to compile a simple test program. It fails with the following output: <denchmark-code>Change Dir: /Users/aditya/GSOC/mlpack-3.0.4/build/CMakeFiles/CMakeTmp
Run Build Command:"/usr/bin/make" "cmTC_f1156/fast" /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/usr/bin/make -f CMakeFiles/cmTC_f1156.dir/build.make CMakeFiles/cmTC_f1156.dir/build Building CXX object CMakeFiles/cmTC_f1156.dir/testCXXCompiler.cxx.o /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/c++ -std=libc++ -isysroot /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Platforms/MacOSX.platform/Developer/SDKs/MacOSX10.14.sdk -o CMakeFiles/cmTC_f1156.dir/testCXXCompiler.cxx.o -c /Users/aditya/GSOC/mlpack-3.0.4/build/CMakeFiles/CMakeTmp/testCXXCompiler.cxx error: invalid value 'libc++' in '-std=libc++' note: use 'c++98' or 'c++03' for 'ISO C++ 1998 with amendments' standard note: use 'gnu++98' or 'gnu++03' for 'ISO C++ 1998 with amendments and GNU extensions' standard note: use 'c++11' for 'ISO C++ 2011 with amendments' standard note: use 'gnu++11' for 'ISO C++ 2011 with amendments and GNU extensions' standard note: use 'c++14' for 'ISO C++ 2014 with amendments' standard note: use 'gnu++14' for 'ISO C++ 2014 with amendments and GNU extensions' standard note: use 'c++17' for 'ISO C++ 2017 with amendments' standard note: use 'gnu++17' for 'ISO C++ 2017 with amendments and GNU extensions' standard note: use 'c++2a' for 'Working draft for ISO C++ 2020' standard note: use 'gnu++2a' for 'Working draft for ISO C++ 2020 with GNU extensions' standard make[1]: *** [CMakeFiles/cmTC_f1156.dir/testCXXCompiler.cxx.o] Error 1 make: *** [cmTC_f1156/fast] Error 2 </denchmark-code>
CMake will not be able to correctly generate this project. Call Stack (most recent call first): CMakeLists.txt:2 (project) -- Configuring incomplete, errors occurred! See also "/Users/aditya/GSOC/mlpack-3.0.4/build/CMakeFiles/CMakeOutput.log". See also "/Users/aditya/GSOC/mlpack-3.0.4/build/CMakeFiles/CMakeError.log".
Use -stdlib=libc++ not -std=libc++ please and try again, thanks.

Got the following error: $ cmake -DCMAKE_CXX_FLAGS="-stdlib=libc++" .. -- The CXX compiler identification is AppleClang 10.0.0.10001145 -- Check for working CXX compiler: /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/c++ -- Check for working CXX compiler: /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/c++ -- works -- Detecting CXX compiler ABI info -- Detecting CXX compiler ABI info - done -- Detecting CXX compile features -- Detecting CXX compile features - done -- cotire 1.7.10 loaded. -- Found Armadillo: /usr/local/lib/libarmadillo.dylib (found suitable version "9.100.5", minimum required is "6.500.0") -- Armadillo libraries: /usr/local/lib/libarmadillo.dylib -- Boost version: 1.68.0 -- Found the following Boost libraries: -- program_options -- unit_test_framework -- serialization -- Could NOT find OpenMP_C (missing: OpenMP_C_FLAGS OpenMP_C_LIB_NAMES) -- Could NOT find OpenMP_CXX (missing: OpenMP_CXX_FLAGS OpenMP_CXX_LIB_NAMES) -- Could NOT find OpenMP (missing: OpenMP_C_FOUND OpenMP_CXX_FOUND) -- Found Git: /usr/local/bin/git (found version "2.18.0") -- gitversion.hpp is already up to date. -- Regenerating arma_config.hpp. CMake Warning at CMakeLists.txt:425 (message): txt2man not found; make: *** [all] Error 2

This is a little bit strange. It seems like Cython is trying to link against libstdc++ even though the system compiler is not able to do that. I found the following post on StackOverflow: <denchmark-link:https://stackoverflow.com/questions/52460913/compiling-cython-with-xcode10>https://stackoverflow.com/questions/52460913/compiling-cython-with-xcode10</denchmark-link>
So I wrote this file: <denchmark-link:http://www.ratml.org/misc/setup-2.py.in>http://www.ratml.org/misc/setup-2.py.in</denchmark-link> . Can you try putting that one in place as and seeing what happens? In the end this comes down to getting the right compile and link options passed to the Cython compiler. In that setup-2.py.in file, you can see my modifications: <denchmark-code>extra_link_args.append('-stdlib=libc++') extra_link_args.append('-mmacosx-version-min=10.9') </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-code>extra_args.append('-mmacosx-version-min=10.9') </denchmark-code>
So, if the file I gave doesn't work, please feel free to try other things to make it work. I can't reproduce the failure so it's a bit hard for me to debug from afar.

I was also facing the same issue just today! I tried several things but could not fix it. Only this:
So I wrote this file: http://www.ratml.org/misc/setup-2.py.in. Can you try putting that one in place as > src/mlpack/bindings/python/setup.py.in and seeing what happens?
fixed it. Could the repository be updated with this setup-2.py content if this issue is reopened?
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/seewishnew>@seewishnew</denchmark-link> thanks! I will open a PR with the fix and get it merged in when I have a chance.
